Clip.Title: MISSION CRITICAL: AMPHIBIAN RESCUE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Follow the race to first find and them rescue the Mountain harlequin frog before the deadly chytrid fungus wipes out the entire species after 200 millions years on Earth.

Clip.Title: NATURE'S DIVE BOMBERS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Along the South African Coast, the Cape Gannet colonies feast on the East Coast, while those on the West Coast starve and struggle to survive due to commercial fishing.

Clip.Title: OL PEJETA DIARIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Translocating two white rhino to Ol Pejeta from the nearby Enasoit ranch after it was discovered that poachers had been watching the animals.

Clip.Title: OL PEJETA DIARIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: With elephant numbers on the rise, so too are the conflicts. Ol Pejeta has to deal with a gang of crops raiding the elephants. The order is given to detusk 3 elephant, but first the team will have to remove a collar from a blind elephant.

Clip.Title: MISSION CRITICAL: AMPHIBIAN RESCUE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Follow the race to first find and them rescue the Mountain harlequin frog before the deadly chytrid fungus wipes out the entire species after 200 millions years on Earth.

Clip.Title: PARK FOR ALL SEASONS; A
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Waterton National Park lies on the border of two of Canada's most striking landscapes-the Rocky Mountains and the vast prairie grasslands. The contrast of these two biologically diverse ecosystems makes this one of the best places in the country to spot wildlife.

Clip.Title: PARK FOR ALL SEASONS; A
Clip.EpisodeSummary: One of the world's largest polar bear denning sites, Wapusk means "white bear" in the native Cree language. The park is a unique ecological zone bordering the arctic, hosting both tundra and coastal marine environments.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Haida Gwaii's Southern coastlines are a case study in remote, barren beauty - a cultural, and geological past told through the stunning landscape of Gwaii Haanas National Park Reserve.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: High above the St. Lawrence River and into the Gulf of St. Lawrence, an aerial survey above the Gaspe peninsula reveals a set of natural wonders - from the Blue Whales to the stone marvels.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the port city of Halifax, to the historic Acadian shores and international waters beyond, this aerial exploration documents the treasures and mysteries of Nova Scotia's Southern coast.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Eastern Coastline of Nova Scotia is a living historical record of the centuries-old battle between the French and the English in the New World, along one of the Atlantic's most remote, hostile coastlines.

Clip.Title: BORN FIGHTING
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Senator James Webb traces the early battles and evolving personality quirks of a group in Scotland that, centuries later, would help forge the American spirit.

Clip.Title: BORN FIGHTING
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Senator James Webb goes on a personal journey to trace the story of the Scots-Irish, from their exodus to the New World in the 1700s to their massive cultural and political influence on America today.

Clip.Title: FIGHTING IRISH OF THE CIVIL WAR
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Irish Brigade, or Fighting Irish were new arrivals to America, proud soldiers who fought on side with Americans in the Civil War, paving the way for all immigrant groups that followed.

Clip.Title: FIGHTING IRISH OF THE CIVIL WAR
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Irish Brigade along with with their exiled leader fought for the Union in the Civil War with much courage, battle after battle.

Clip.Title: BORN FIGHTING
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Senator James Webb traces the early battles and evolving personality quirks of a group in Scotland that, centuries later, would help forge the American spirit.

Clip.Title: BORN FIGHTING
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Senator James Webb goes on a personal journey to trace the story of the Scots-Irish, from their exodus to the New World in the 1700s to their massive cultural and political influence on America today.
